etymologies: mid 16th century: via Latin from Greek parasitos ‘(person) eating at another's table’, from para- ‘alongside’ + sitos ‘food’

definitions: an organism that lives in or on an organism of another species (its host) and benefits by deriving nutrients at the other's expense

examples.text: the parasite attaches itself to the mouths of fishes

notes.text: Parasites exist in huge variety, including animals, plants, and microorganisms. They may live as ectoparasites on the surface of the host (e.g., arthropods such as ticks, mites, lice, fleas, and many insects infesting plants) or as endoparasites in the gut or tissues (e.g., many kinds of worm), and cause varying degrees of damage or disease to the host

shortDefinitions: organism that lives in or on another organism and benefits by deriving nutrients at other's expense

definitions: a person who habitually relies on or exploits others and gives nothing in return

examples.text: he was a parasite who lived off other people

shortDefinitions: person who habitually relies on or exploits others and gives nothing in return
